get.description: Get Spotify catalog information for a single album.

available_markets.description: The markets in which the album is available: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2). _**NOTE**: an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market._

copyrights.description: The copyright statements of the album.

text.description: The copyright text for this content.

type.description: The type of copyright: `C` = the copyright, `P` = the sound recording (performance) copyright.

genres.description: A list of the genres the album is associated with. If not yet classified, the array is empty.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

images.description: The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

label.description: The label associated with the album.

name.description: The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string.

popularity.description: The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

release_date.description: The date the album was first released.

release_date_precision.description: The precision with which `release_date` value is known.

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Albums may be restricted if the content is not available in a given market, to the user's subscription type, or when the user's account is set to not play explicit content.
Additional reasons may be added in the future.

total_tracks.description: The number of tracks in the album.

artists.description: The artists of the album. Each artist object includes a link in `href` to more detailed information about the artist.

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Supported values:
- `market` - The content item is not available in the given market.
- `product` - The content item is not available for the user's subscription type.
- `explicit` - The content item is explicit and the user's account is set to not play explicit content.

Additional reasons may be added in the future.
**Note**: If you use this field, make sure that your application safely handles unknown values.

get.description:
Get detailed profile information about the current user (including the
current user's username).

country.description: The country of the user, as set in the user's account profile. An [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2). _This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the [user-read-private](/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes) scope._

display_name.description: The name displayed on the user's profile. `null` if not available.

email.description: The user's email address, as entered by the user when creating their account. _**Important!** This email address is unverified; there is no proof that it actually belongs to the user._ _This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the [user-read-email](/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes) scope._

filter_enabled.description: When `true`, indicates that explicit content should not be played.

filter_locked.description: When `true`, indicates that the explicit content setting is locked and can't be changed by the user.

href.description: This will always be set to null, as the Web API does not support it at the moment.
A link to the Web API endpoint for this user.

images.description: The user's profile image.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

product.description: The user's Spotify subscription level: "premium", "free", etc. (The subscription level "open" can be considered the same as "free".) _This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the [user-read-private](/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes) scope._

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves detailed profile information about the current user without any required input parameters, returning data such as the user's ID, display name, email, country, profile images, followers, explicit content settings, subscription level, and Spotify URI.

delete.description: Remove one or more albums from the current user's 'Your Music' library.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of the [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids) for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.
schema.title: Spotify Album IDs

schema.description: Album(s) have been removed from the library

delete.detailed_description: This API allows you to remove up to 20 albums from the current user's 'Your Music' library by providing their Spotify album IDs in a comma-separated list, with the response confirming the removal action ("Album(s) have been removed from the library").

ids.description:
A JSON array of the [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids). For example: `["4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh", "1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"]`
A maximum of 50 items can be specified in one request. _**Note**: if the `ids` parameter is present in the query string, any IDs listed here in the body will be ignored._

get.description: Get a list of the albums saved in the current Spotify user's 'Your Music' library.

limit.description: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

previous.description: URL to the previous page of items. ( `null` if none)

total.description: The total number of items available to return.

added_at.description:
The date and time the album was saved
Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
If the time is imprecise (for example, the date/time of an album release), an additional field indicates the precision; see for example, release_date in an album object.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves a list of albums saved in the current user's Spotify 'Your Music' library, returning details including the total number of albums, their attributes (such as name, release date, and cover images), and pagination information (like next and previous URLs).

put.description: Save one or more albums to the current user's 'Your Music' library.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of the [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids) for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.
schema.title: Spotify Album IDs

put.detailed_description: This API allows you to save one or more albums to your Spotify library by providing a comma-separated list of up to 20 album IDs, and it confirms the action with a response stating "The album is saved."

ids.description:
A JSON array of the [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids). For example: `["4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh", "1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"]`
A maximum of 50 items can be specified in one request. _**Note**: if the `ids` parameter is present in the query string, any IDs listed here in the body will be ignored._

delete.description: Remove the current user as a follower of one or more artists or other Spotify users.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of the artist or the user [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids). For example: `ids=74ASZWbe4lXaubB36ztrGX,08td7MxkoHQkXnWAYD8d6Q`. A maximum of 50 IDs can be sent in one request.
schema.title: Spotify IDs

delete.detailed_description: This API allows you to unfollow multiple artists or users on Spotify by providing their IDs in a comma-separated list and the type ('artist' or 'user'), with the response confirming the action ("Artist or user unfollowed").

ids.description: A JSON array of the artist or user [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids). For example: `{ids:["74ASZWbe4lXaubB36ztrGX", "08td7MxkoHQkXnWAYD8d6Q"]}`. A maximum of 50 IDs can be sent in one request. _**Note**: if the `ids` parameter is present in the query string, any IDs listed here in the body will be ignored._

put.description: Add the current user as a follower of one or more artists or other Spotify users.

schema.description:
A comma-separated list of the artist or the user [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids).
A maximum of 50 IDs can be sent in one request.
schema.title: Spotify IDs

put.detailed_description: This API allows the current user to follow multiple Spotify artists or users by providing their type (either 'artist' or 'user') and a comma-separated list of their Spotify IDs, returning a confirmation response that the artist or user has been followed.

ids.description:
A JSON array of the artist or user [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids).
For example: `{ids:["74ASZWbe4lXaubB36ztrGX", "08td7MxkoHQkXnWAYD8d6Q"]}`. A maximum of 50 IDs can be sent in one request. _**Note**: if the `ids` parameter is present in the query string, any IDs listed here in the body will be ignored._

get.description: Get information about the user’s current playback state, including track or episode, progress, and active device.
get.detailed_description: This API fetches the current playback state for the user, including details about the active track or episode, progress, and active device, while indicating if playback is not available or active.

get.description: Get the track currently being played on the user's Spotify account.

skipping_next.description: Skipping to the next context. Optional field.

skipping_prev.description: Skipping to the previous context. Optional field.

toggling_repeat_context.description: Toggling repeat context flag. Optional field.

toggling_repeat_track.description: Toggling repeat track flag. Optional field.

transferring_playback.description: Transfering playback between devices. Optional field.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

currently_playing_type.description: The object type of the currently playing item. Can be one of `track`, `episode`, `ad` or `unknown`.

is_active.description: If this device is the currently active device.

is_private_session.description: If this device is currently in a private session.

is_restricted.description: Whether controlling this device is restricted. At present if this is "true" then no Web API commands will be accepted by this device.

name.description: A human-readable name for the device. Some devices have a name that the user can configure (e.g. \"Loudest speaker\") and some devices have a generic name associated with the manufacturer or device model.

is_playing.description: If something is currently playing, return `true`.

item.description: The currently playing track or episode. Can be `null`.

genres.description: A list of the genres the album is associated with. If not yet classified, the array is empty.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

images.description: The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

label.description: The label associated with the album.

name.description: The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string.

popularity.description: The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

release_date.description: The date the album was first released.

total_tracks.description: The number of tracks in the album.

album_group.description: The field is present when getting an artist's albums. Compare to album_type this field represents relationship between the artist and the album.

artists.description: The artists of the album. Each artist object includes a link in `href` to more detailed information about the artist.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the artist.

artists.description: The artists who performed the track. Each artist object includes a link in `href` to more detailed information about the artist.

href.description: This will always be set to null, as the Web API does not support it at the moment.

genres.description: A list of the genres the artist is associated with. If not yet classified, the array is empty.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the artist.

images.description: Images of the artist in various sizes, widest first.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

popularity.description: The popularity of the artist. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The artist's popularity is calculated from the popularity of all the artist's tracks.

available_markets.description: A list of the countries in which the track can be played, identified by their [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.

disc_number.description: The disc number (usually `1` unless the album consists of more than one disc).

explicit.description: Whether or not the track has explicit lyrics ( `true` = yes it does; `false` = no it does not OR unknown).

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

is_local.description: Whether or not the track is from a local file.

is_playable.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied. If `true`, the track is playable in the given market. Otherwise `false`.

linked_from.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied, and the requested track has been replaced with different track. The track in the `linked_from` object contains information about the originally requested track.

popularity.description:
The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.
The popularity of a track is a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are.
Generally speaking, songs that are being played a lot now will have a higher popularity than songs that were played a lot in the past. Duplicate tracks (e.g. the same track from a single and an album) are rated independently. Artist and album popularity is derived mathematically from track popularity. _**Note**: the popularity value may lag actual popularity by a few days: the value is not updated in real time._

preview_url.description: A link to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the track. Can be `null`

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Supported values:
- `market` - The content item is not available in the given market.
- `product` - The content item is not available for the user's subscription type.
- `explicit` - The content item is explicit and the user's account is set to not play explicit content.

Additional reasons may be added in the future.
**Note**: If you use this field, make sure that your application safely handles unknown values.

track_number.description: The number of the track. If an album has several discs, the track number is the number on the specified disc.

audio_preview_url.description: A URL to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the episode. `null` if not available.

description.description: A description of the episode. HTML tags are stripped away from this field, use `html_description` field in case HTML tags are needed.
description.example: A Spotify podcast sharing fresh insights on important topics of the moment—in a way only Spotify can. You’ll hear from experts in the music, podcast and tech industries as we discover and uncover stories about our work and the world around us.

explicit.description: Whether or not the episode has explicit content (true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).

html_description.description: A description of the episode. This field may contain HTML tags.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

is_externally_hosted.description: True if the episode is hosted outside of Spotify's CDN.

language.description: The language used in the episode, identified by a [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639) code. This field is deprecated and might be removed in the future. Please use the `languages` field instead.

languages.description: A list of the languages used in the episode, identified by their [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639) code.

progress_ms.description: Progress into the currently playing track or episode. Can be `null`.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves the track currently playing on the user's Spotify account without requiring any input parameters, returning information about the track or episode, playback state, device information, and available actions.

get.description: Get information about a user’s available devices.

is_active.description: If this device is the currently active device.

is_private_session.description: If this device is currently in a private session.

is_restricted.description: Whether controlling this device is restricted. At present if this is "true" then no Web API commands will be accepted by this device.

name.description: A human-readable name for the device. Some devices have a name that the user can configure (e.g. \"Loudest speaker\") and some devices have a generic name associated with the manufacturer or device model.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves information about a user's available devices, returning details such as device ID, name, type, current volume percentage, and session status with no required input parameters.

post.description: Skips to next track in the user’s queue.
post.detailed_description: This API allows the user to skip to the next track in their queue by sending a POST request, with the response confirming that the command was sent ("Command sent").

put.description: Pause playback on the user's account.
put.detailed_description: This API pauses playback on the user's Spotify account and returns a response confirming that the playback has been paused.

put.description: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user's active device.
put.detailed_description: This API starts a new context or resumes playback on the user's active device, with the response confirming that the playback has started.

context_uri.description:
Optional. Spotify URI of the context to play.
Valid contexts are albums, artists & playlists.
`{context_uri:"spotify:album:1Je1IMUlBXcx1Fz0WE7oPT"}`

offset.description:
Optional. Indicates from where in the context playback should start. Only available when context_uri corresponds to an album or playlist object
"position" is zero based and can’t be negative. Example: `"offset": {"position": 5}`
"uri" is a string representing the uri of the item to start at. Example: `"offset": {"uri": "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"}`

uris.description:
Optional. A JSON array of the Spotify track URIs to play.
For example: `{"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh", "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"]}`

post.description: Skips to previous track in the user’s queue.
post.detailed_description: This API allows users to skip to the previous track in their queue by sending a POST request, with the response confirming the command was sent ("Command sent").

is_externally_hosted.description: True if all of the shows episodes are hosted outside of Spotify's CDN. This field might be `null` in some cases.

languages.description: A list of the languages used in the show, identified by their [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639) code.

media_type.description: The media type of the show.

total_episodes.description: The total number of episodes in the show.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves the user's queue on Spotify, providing details about currently playing tracks or episodes, as well as the queued tracks or episodes, each containing information like album details, artists, and availability in markets.

post.description: Add an item to the end of the user's current playback queue.

schema.description: The uri of the item to add to the queue. Must be a track or an episode uri.
schema.title: Spotify URI

post.detailed_description: This API allows you to add a track or episode to the user's current playback queue by providing the item's Spotify URI, returning a confirmation message indicating that the command has been received.

get.description:
Get tracks from the current user's recently played tracks.
_**Note**: Currently doesn't support podcast episodes._

after.description: The cursor to use as key to find the next page of items.

before.description: The cursor to use as key to find the previous page of items.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint returning the full result of the request.

limit.description: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

next.description: URL to the next page of items. ( `null` if none)

total.description: The total number of items available to return.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

played_at.description: The date and time the track was played.

available_markets.description: The markets in which the album is available: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2). _**NOTE**: an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market._

copyrights.description: The copyright statements of the album.

text.description: The copyright text for this content.

type.description: The type of copyright: `C` = the copyright, `P` = the sound recording (performance) copyright.

genres.description: A list of the genres the album is associated with. If not yet classified, the array is empty.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

images.description: The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

label.description: The label associated with the album.

name.description: The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string.

popularity.description: The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

release_date.description: The date the album was first released.

release_date_precision.description: The precision with which `release_date` value is known.

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Albums may be restricted if the content is not available in a given market, to the user's subscription type, or when the user's account is set to not play explicit content.
Additional reasons may be added in the future.

total_tracks.description: The number of tracks in the album.

album_group.description: The field is present when getting an artist's albums. Compare to album_type this field represents relationship between the artist and the album.

artists.description: The artists of the album. Each artist object includes a link in `href` to more detailed information about the artist.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the artist.

artists.description: The artists who performed the track. Each artist object includes a link in `href` to more detailed information about the artist.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the artist.

images.description: Images of the artist in various sizes, widest first.

url.description: The source URL of the image.

popularity.description: The popularity of the artist. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The artist's popularity is calculated from the popularity of all the artist's tracks.

available_markets.description: A list of the countries in which the track can be played, identified by their [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.

explicit.description: Whether or not the track has explicit lyrics ( `true` = yes it does; `false` = no it does not OR unknown).

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

is_local.description: Whether or not the track is from a local file.

is_playable.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied. If `true`, the track is playable in the given market. Otherwise `false`.

linked_from.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied, and the requested track has been replaced with different track. The track in the `linked_from` object contains information about the originally requested track.

popularity.description:
The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.
The popularity of a track is a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are.
Generally speaking, songs that are being played a lot now will have a higher popularity than songs that were played a lot in the past. Duplicate tracks (e.g. the same track from a single and an album) are rated independently. Artist and album popularity is derived mathematically from track popularity. _**Note**: the popularity value may lag actual popularity by a few days: the value is not updated in real time._

preview_url.description: A link to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the track. Can be `null`

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Supported values:
- `market` - The content item is not available in the given market.
- `product` - The content item is not available for the user's subscription type.
- `explicit` - The content item is explicit and the user's account is set to not play explicit content.

Additional reasons may be added in the future.
**Note**: If you use this field, make sure that your application safely handles unknown values.

track_number.description: The number of the track. If an album has several discs, the track number is the number on the specified disc.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves the currently playing user's recently played tracks, outputting details such as track name, artists, play date and time, and a cursor for pagination but requires no input parameters.

put.description:
Set the repeat mode for the user's playback. Options are repeat-track,
repeat-context, and off.

schema.description:
**track**, **context** or **off**.
**track** will repeat the current track.
**context** will repeat the current context.
**off** will turn repeat off.
schema.title: State

put.detailed_description: This API allows users to set the playback repeat mode by specifying a state value of "track", "context", or "off", with the response confirming that the command has been sent.

put.description: Set the volume for the user’s current playback device.

schema.description: The volume to set. Must be a value from 0 to 100 inclusive.
schema.title: Volume %

put.detailed_description: This API sets the volume for the user's current playback device by accepting a volume percentage (0 to 100), with the response confirming that the command was successfully sent.

get.description:

user.

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint returning the full result of the request

limit.description: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

next.description: URL to the next page of items. ( `null` if none)

offset.description: The offset of the items returned (as set in the query or by default)

previous.description: URL to the previous page of items. ( `null` if none)

See [Working with Playlists](/documentation/general/guides/working-with-playlists/). _**Note**: If returned, the source URL for the image (`url`) is temporary and will expire in less than a day._

href.description: This will always be set to null, as the Web API does not support it at the moment.

display_name.description: The name displayed on the user's profile. `null` if not available.

snapshot_id.description: The version identifier for the current playlist. Can be supplied in other requests to target a specific playlist version

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint where full details of the playlist's tracks can be retrieved.

total.description: Number of tracks in the playlist.

get.detailed_description: This API retrieves a list of playlists owned or followed by the current Spotify user, returning details such as playlist name, owner, public status, and tracks, with pagination support through `limit`, `offset`, and URLs for navigation.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of the [Spotify IDs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids). For example: `ids=4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh,1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M`. Maximum: 50 IDs.
schema.title: Spotify Track IDs

delete.detailed_description: This API allows you to remove multiple tracks from your 'Your Music' library by providing a comma-separated list of Spotify track IDs, returning a confirmation message that a track has been removed.

ids.description:

A maximum of 50 items can be specified in one request. _**Note**: if the `ids` parameter is present in the query string, any IDs listed here in the body will be ignored._

Duplicate tracks (e.g. the same track from a single and an album) are rated independently. Artist and album popularity is derived mathematically from track popularity. _**Note**: the popularity value may lag actual popularity by a few days: the value is not updated in real time._

put.description:

course, own the playlist.)

public.description: If `true` the playlist will be public, if `false` it will be private.

delete.description: Remove one or more items from a user's playlist.
delete.detailed_description: This API allows you to remove tracks from a user's Spotify playlist by providing the playlist ID, and it returns a snapshot ID reflecting the updated state of the playlist.

snapshot_id.description:
The playlist's snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes.
The API will validate that the specified items exist and in the specified positions and make the changes,
even if more recent changes have been made to the playlist.

tracks.description:
An array of objects containing [Spotify URIs](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids) of the tracks or episodes to remove.

get.detailed_description: This API allows you to retrieve detailed information for the tracks of a specific playlist owned by a Spotify user by providing its Spotify playlist ID, returning data such as track name, artist name, album name, and more.

post.description: Add one or more items to a user's playlist.
post.detailed_description: This API allows you to add items to a specific user's playlist by providing the Spotify playlist ID, and it responds with the snapshot ID of the updated playlist.

position.description: The position to insert the items, a zero-based index. For example, to insert the items in the first position: `position=0` ; to insert the items in the third position: `position=2`. If omitted, the items will be appended to the playlist. Items are added in the order they appear in the uris array. For example: `{"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"], "position": 3}`

uris.description:
A JSON array of the [Spotify URIs](/documentation/web-api/#spotify-uris-and-ids) to add. For example: `{"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"]}`
A maximum of 100 items can be added in one request. _**Note**: if the `uris` parameter is present in the query string, any URIs listed here in the body will be ignored._

get.description:
Get Spotify catalog information about albums, artists, playlists, tracks, shows, episodes or audiobooks that match a keyword string.
**Note: Audiobooks are only available for the US, UK, Ireland, New Zealand and Australia markets.**

schema.description:
Your search query. You can narrow down your search using field filters. The available filters are `album`, `artist`, `track`, `year`, `upc`, `tag:hipster`, `tag:new`, `isrc`, and `genre`. Each field filter only applies to certain result types. The `artist` and `year` filters can be used while searching albums, artists and tracks. You can filter on a single `year` or a range (e.g. 1955-1960).
The `album` filter can be used while searching albums and tracks.
The `genre` filter can be used while searching artists and tracks.
The `isrc` and `track` filters can be used while searching tracks.
The `upc`, `tag:new` and `tag:hipster` filters can only be used while searching albums. The `tag:new` filter will return albums released in the past two weeks and `tag:hipster` can be used to return only albums with the lowest 10% popularity.
schema.title: Query

schema.description:
A comma-separated list of item types to search across. Search results include hits
from all the specified item types. For example: `q=abacab&type=album,track` returns
both albums and tracks matching "abacab".

is_local.description: Whether or not the track is from a local file.

is_playable.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied. If `true`, the track is playable in the given market. Otherwise `false`.

linked_from.description: Part of the response when [Track Relinking](/documentation/general/guides/track-relinking-guide/) is applied, and the requested track has been replaced with different track. The track in the `linked_from` object contains information about the originally requested track.

popularity.description:
The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.
The popularity of a track is a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are.
Generally speaking, songs that are being played a lot now will have a higher popularity than songs that were played a lot in the past. Duplicate tracks (e.g. the same track from a single and an album) are rated independently. Artist and album popularity is derived mathematically from track popularity. _**Note**: the popularity value may lag actual popularity by a few days: the value is not updated in real time._

preview_url.description: A link to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the track. Can be `null`

reason.description:
The reason for the restriction. Supported values:
- `market` - The content item is not available in the given market.
- `product` - The content item is not available for the user's subscription type.
- `explicit` - The content item is explicit and the user's account is set to not play explicit content.

Additional reasons may be added in the future.
**Note**: If you use this field, make sure that your application safely handles unknown values.

track_number.description: The number of the track. If an album has several discs, the track number is the number on the specified disc.

post.detailed_description: This API enables the creation of a new playlist for a specified Spotify user by providing their user ID, and the response includes key details like the playlist name, owner, collaborative status, and available markets.

collaborative.description: Defaults to `false`. If `true` the playlist will be collaborative. _**Note**: to create a collaborative playlist you must also set `public` to `false`. To create collaborative playlists you must have granted `playlist-modify-private` and `playlist-modify-public` [scopes](/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes)._

description.description: value for playlist description as displayed in Spotify Clients and in the Web API.

name.description: The name for the new playlist, for example `"Your Coolest Playlist"`. This name does not need to be unique; a user may have several playlists with the same name.

public.description: Defaults to `true`. If `true` the playlist will be public, if `false` it will be private. To be able to create private playlists, the user must have granted the `playlist-modify-private` [scope](/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes)
